Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2009 03:29PM firstmate wrote: I had my implants in Sept and ecapsulated on one side only.  I had a capsulotomy in November, but that side still feels very tight.  I see the PS tomorrow.  I hope I have not encapsulated again.  The PS told me that one theory is low-grade infection, so he irrigated the site with antibiotics during surgery.
Posts.Title: lets talk implant capsulating?? joanne2 joanne2

Posts.Title: 100 things never to say to a woman who has had a mastectomy: iwannabefree jillyG

Posts.Content: firstmate wrote: I just developed two actinic keratosis lesions on my breast after a mastectomy for DCIS.  I had an appointment with my GYN a few days ago and she said it was nothing to worry about.  However, I looked it up on the internet and found that it is a precurser to skin cancer.  I have an appointments scheduled in a month with my PS and surgeon, but I am wondering if anyone else has had these type of lesions on their reconstructed breasts. Robin Dx 1/29/2008, DCIS, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/7 nodes Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Actinic keratosis after mastectomy firstmate abinneb
Actinic keratosis after mastectomy firstmate abinneb

Posts.Content: firstmate wrote: Has anyone developed neck/shoulder muscle pain (I guess) after surgery?   I had a reconstruction revision/capsulotomy with allograft on 3/18 and have been having really bad neck and shoulder pain.  My breast area doesn't hurt at all anymore, but my neck is killing me. Robin Dx 1/29/2008, DCIS, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/7 nodes Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2009 12:52PM firstmate wrote: I am also a fairskinned, freckled redhead with lots of skin exposure, but not on my breasts.  I was always quite modest.  My GYN looked at the lesions this week and diagnosed them as actinic keratosis.  I have appts with my dermatologist, PS and surgeon at the end of Feb.  Is that soon enought or should I move the appointment up earlier?
